intro: Myrsine neurophylla, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small white or pale yellow flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Myrsine neurophylla is typically found in forest understories, thriving in moist, shaded environments. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
